problem: Let $\mathbf{v} = \begin{pmatrix} -7 \\ 1 \end{pmatrix}$ and $\mathbf{w} = \begin{pmatrix} 5 \\ 2 \end{pmatrix}.$  Find the area of the parallelogram with vertices $\mathbf{0},$ $\mathbf{v},$ $\mathbf{w},$ and $\mathbf{v} + \mathbf{w}.$
solution: The area of the parallelogram is given by $|(-7)(2) - (5)(1)| = \boxed{19}.$
model_solution:
Step 1: Recall that the area of the parallelogram with vertices $\mathbf{0},$ $\mathbf{v},$ $\mathbf{w},$ and $\mathbf{v} + \mathbf{w}$ is given by the magnitude of the determinant of the $2 \times 2$ matrix $\begin{pmatrix} \mathbf{v} & \mathbf{w} \end{pmatrix}.$

The final answer is: $\boxed{\begin{pmatrix} -7 & 5 \\ 1 & 2 \end{pmatrix}}$

The final answer is: $\boxed{\begin{pmatrix} -7 & 5 \\ 1 & 2 \end{pmatrix}}$
